thread.title: NLDS Game 3: Dodgers at Mets, Monday, 5/5:30 p.m.
thread.title_full: NLDS Game 3: Dodgers at Mets, Monday, 5/5:30 p.m. - Press Enterprise

author: BILL PLUNKETT
title: NLDS Game 3: Dodgers at Mets, Monday, 5/5:30 p.m.
text:
By BILL PLUNKETT / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 11, 2015 Updated: 5:16 p.m. Where: Citi Field
TV: TBS, 5 or 5:30 p.m.
Did you know: The Dodgers are 12-10 at Citi Field since it opened for the 2009 season. But that includes nine wins in their past 13 games there.
THE PITCHERS
LHP BRETT ANDERSON (10-9, 3.69)
After five injury-riddled seasons in which he pitched more than 100 innings just once, Anderson stayed healthy this year and set career highs for starts (31) and innings pitched (1801/3). He also led the majors in ground ball rate. Anderson went 72/3 innings in his final regular-season start 11 days ago. That was the first time since July he had completed seven innings in a start.
Vs. Mets: First game
RHP MATT HARVEY (13-8, 2.71)
Like Jacob deGrom and Noah Syndergaard before him, Matt Harvey will be making his first playoff start. With all the discussion about capping Harveyâ€™s innings in his first season since returning from Tommy John surgery, Harvey got extended rest between each of his five September starts and pitched a total of only 291/3 innings during the month.
Vs. Dodgers: 1-2, 4.50
At Citi Field: 12-8, 2.05
Postseason history: First game
Contact the writer: bplunkett@ocregister.com
